from the Ministerof Health, in regard to the details of the scheme;and from the Chancellor of the Exchequer, in regardto its finance; the Cabinet agreed - (a) To approve the proposals-of the Ministerof Health as set forth in Cabinet PaperCo P. -204 (25), including the Widows1 ,Orphans" and Old Age contributory pensions Bill attached thereto:.(b) That, before the Bill is completed * theMinister of Health should be asked to look into the following questions:(i) Whether some special provision should be made to prevent aliensfrom flocking to this country with their dependants with a viewto obtaining the benefits of theAct:(ii) Whether some corresponding pro-vision should be introduced toprevent excessive immigration into Great Britain from Irelandwith the same object.(c) That, before the Bill is completed, theChancellor of the Exchequer should eon-side r the suggestion made by the Secretaryof State for "War at the Cabinet Committeethat some means should be sought forlinking up the State finance of thescheme "so that, if possible j the state contribution should bear a definiteratio to the benefits, as in the caseof the National Health Insurance:(d) That, in view of the careful considera-tion already given to the question bythe Cabinet Committee, the Widows1,Orphans' and Old Age contributory pensions Bill need not be examined bythe Committee of Home Affairs before its introduction in Parliament: -(e) That the Bill should be introduced bythe Minister of Health, but that, inview of the essential connection betweenits financial provisions and the finance bill, the Chancellor of the exchequer should deal with the question in his budget Statement:(f) To place on record their thanks to theMinisters who had given so much timeand effort to this"important measure.
